Rich,

Very nice tsuba. I would have thought later generation
Akasaka or side branch Akasaka if it weren't signed.
Circa 1750 to 1800.

Yet just saw Jim's answer of c. 1800.
   Jim- anything other than the signature to
distiquish these? Anything about the iron that might
be a clue?

Good looking tsuba.

Curran



--- Richard Turner <ikkanshi@...> wrote:
> Hi all, I am wondering how long the tosa tsuba
> smiths worked as I have mention on them in my books
> but they all seem to around the early mid 1600's. I
> am curious as to a tsuba signed Toshu Ju Kuniyoshi
> Saku and am wondering if anyone knows of this smith
> ?? It looks very much like an Akasaka piece.
> 
> cheers all
> 
> Rich
